cip.render.raytrace.geometry

Class PlanarPolyhedra

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.AGeometry
      • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.PlanarPolyhedra
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtGeometry

    public class PlanarPolyhedra
extends AGeometry
    A convex planar polyhedra described by the plane equations of the faces.

    There are methods to programmatically initialize a planar polyhedra, but, it is most common to load the planar polyhedra from a scene description file. The planar polyhedra is specified as a node in an XML scene description file as: 

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.geometry.PlanarPolyhedra" name="polyhedraName">
         <face plane="A,B,C,D"/>
           .
           .
         <face plane="A,B,C,D"/>
         <MaterialByRef>materialName</MaterialByRef>
         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="materialClass">
               .
             material specific nodes and attributes
               .
         </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    where:
    face The plane equation of a face. There are as many face entries as there are faces on the object. The plane equation is normalized during object load.
    MaterialByRef A material specfied by reference to the name of a perviously loaded material. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. If no material is specified, the material defaults to matte green material.
    DynamicallyLoadedObject The specification fof a material for the polyhedra. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. The dynamically loaded object must implement the IRtMaterial interface. If no material is specified, the material defaults to matte green material.

    Example of XML Specification

    The following specifies a unit cube of material red centered on the origin: 

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.geometry.PlanarPolyhedra" name="unitCube">
         <face plane=" 0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f,-0.5f"/>
         <face plane=" 0.0f,-1.0f, 0.0f,-0.5f"/>
         <face plane=" 1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f,-0.5f"/>
         <face plane=" 0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f,-0.5f"/>
         <face plane="-1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f,-0.5f"/>
         <face plane=" 0.0f, 0.0f,-1.0f,-0.5f"/>
         <MaterialByRef>red</MaterialByRef>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    Since:
    1.0

      • loadFromXml

        public void loadFromXml(@NotNull
                        @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element xmlElement,
                        @Nullable
                        @Nullable java.util.LinkedList refObjectList)
                 throws DynXmlObjParseException
        Description copied from class: AGeometry
        The geometry implementation must override this function to load the geometry from the XML node.
        Specified by:
        loadFromXml in interface IDynXmlObject
        Overrides:
        loadFromXml in class AGeometry
        Parameters:
        xmlElement - The dynamically loaded object DOM Document element.
        refObjectList - A linked list if named objects (implementing the INamedObject interface) that have already been loaded and can be used to resolve object references.
        Throws:
        DynXmlObjParseException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the object. If this exception is thrown it should be assumed that this object was incorrectly initialized, is invalid, and should not be used in any further operations.

      • internalToXml

        protected void internalToXml(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        Description copied from class: AGeometry
        Override this function to add object-specific information to an XML node.
        Overrides:
        internalToXml in class AGeometry
        Parameters:
        element - The dynamically loaded object node that the object-specific information should be written into. The AGeometry.loadFromXml(org.w3c.dom.Element, LinkedList) funtion must be overridden by the geometry implementation to be able to read the object-specific information set by the object here.

      • isConvex

        public boolean isConvex()
        Description copied from class: AGeometry
        The default implementation returns false, that the object is not convex.
        Specified by:
        isConvex in interface IRtGeometry
        Overrides:
        isConvex in class AGeometry
        Returns:
        Returns true if the object is convex and false if the object is not convex or the convexity cannot be verified.

      • getRayIntersection

        public boolean getRayIntersection(RayIntersection intersection,
                                  Line3f ray,
                                  boolean bStartsInside,
                                  int nSample,
                                  int nRandom)
        Description copied from class: AGeometry
        Gets the ray intersection. The default implementation simply returns false, there is no intersection.
        Specified by:
        getRayIntersection in interface IRtGeometry
        Overrides:
        getRayIntersection in class AGeometry
        Parameters:
        intersection - The intersection of the ray and the surface. The intersection will be either freshly initialized or will contain information about the closest intersection discovered thus far.
        ray - The ray being tesed for intersection.
        bStartsInside - false if this is an outside ray, true if this is a ray spawned from an intersection with this object and on the inside of the object.
        nSample - The pixel sub-sample index. This is used in distributed ray-tracing to make sure the correct sample displacement is used for samples that are distributed.
        nRandom - The jitter array index..
        Returns:
        Returns true if there is an intersection with this object that is closer than the current intersection, and false otherwise.

      • testShadow

        public boolean testShadow(RayIntersection intersection,
                          Vector3f vLight,
                          float fDistLight,
                          IRtLight light,
                          int nSample,
                          int nRandom)
        Description copied from class: AGeometry
        The default implementation returns false, that there is no cast shadow.
        Specified by:
        testShadow in interface IRtGeometry
        Overrides:
        testShadow in class AGeometry
        Parameters:
        intersection - The intersection being tested for shadow.
        vLight - The direction from the intersection to the light.
        fDistLight - The distance from the intersection to the light.
        light - The light. This is supplied as an argument in the event an object is both a light source and a geometry and the geometry of the light should not be tested for casting a shadow from that light.
        nSample - The pixel sub-sample index. This is used in distributed ray-tracing to make sure the correct sample displacement is used for samples that are distributed.
        nRandom - The jitter array index..
        Returns:
        Returns true if this object casts a shadow from the light and false otherwise.
